LanguageData.ShipBasics.label: Starflight basics
LanguageData.ShipBasics.description: Construct the structural and supportive elements of a starship. This is the first step in building a ship to leave this star system.
LanguageData.ShipCryptosleep.label: Vacuum cryptosleep casket
LanguageData.ShipCryptosleep.description: Construct hardened cryptosleep caskets tough enough to be exposed to vacuum, for transporting people on the years-long journey between stars.
LanguageData.ShipReactor.label: Starship reactor
LanguageData.ShipReactor.description: Build a long-duration nuclear reactor to power a starship. Note that reactors have a long startup process that will attract raiders.
LanguageData.ShipEngine.label: Johnson-Tanaka drive
LanguageData.ShipEngine.description: Construct a Johnson-Tanaka drive for a ship. The JT drive can push you to other stars by leveraging quantum scale effects to beam momentum to distant stars. Of course, as with all starships, it still takes many years to get anywhere.
LanguageData.ShipComputerCore.label: Machine persuasion
LanguageData.ShipComputerCore.description: Build a reward-signal system to persuade an existing persona core into serving as a ship's machine captain. Since people sleep during interstellar travel, a persona core is necessary to handle the complex decisions of a years-long starflight.
LanguageData.ShipSensorCluster.label: Starflight sensors
LanguageData.ShipSensorCluster.description: Construct long-range sensors for a starship. These sensors are essential for navigation, communication, and threat avoidance.
